segments.text: Who is this on the water buffalo ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's my grand-father . He was a farmer . When he was young , he had to take the water buffalo to graze in the field .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh yes , that was the best job in most farm families . That's where many of them learned to play the flute .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My grandfather did that too . He used the time to study instead .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My grand grandfather was a merchant who ran a small business . He couldn't afford to send my grand father to school .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So he became a self-taught man ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Right . Later he was a soldier and a fireman in the village . When he was middle aged , he became a great man , quite famous .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: As a leader of police officers in charge of the whole country .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is he still in that that type of work .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No . He retired from that . He is a senator now .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Would you want to be a senator ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , maybe when I get old . But first I'll be a lawyer .
segments.speaker: S2
